meanings.definition: To dry (something) before further processing or use.
meanings.sent1: I predried the clothes before putting them in the dryer.
meanings.sent2: The chef predried the herbs before adding them to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The sun predried the laundry so well that it felt like cardboard.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement predried the tears that threatened to fall.
meanings.sent5: The desert heat predried the soil, making it hard as rock.

meanings.definition: Having been dried before further processing or use.
meanings.sent1: The predried wood was ready for the carpenter to work with.
meanings.sent2: The predried fruits retained their natural sweetness.
meanings.sent3: The predried sponge soaked up the spill in seconds.
meanings.sent4: His predried wit made him the life of the party.
meanings.sent5: The predried paint clung to the canvas, creating a textured effect.
